name: Beautiful, Brilliant B Multiple Choice Quiz | Alphabetics | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which famous singer played Cinderella in the Disney movie of "Cinderella" made in the USA during the 1990s?
questions.explanation:
Brandy.

	In the original movie version Cinderella was played by Leslie Anne Warren.

questions.text: Where was the Battle of Bunker Hill fought?
questions.explanation:
Breed's Hill.

	This battle was fought June 17, 1775. The British won this battle but lost about 1000 men. Despite the fact the British won this battle, the American Revolution was won by what is now the United States of America.

questions.text: Mr. Barker hosted "The Price Is Right" in the United States of America. What is his first name?
questions.explanation:
Bob.

	Bob Barker hosted "Price is Right" longer than anyone has ever hosted any game show.  He retired in 2007 after 35 years.

questions.text: What is an English equivalent of the Spanish word "chico"?
questions.explanation:
boy.

	El chico is 'the boy'. La chica is 'the girl'. Las chicas is 'the girls'. Los chicos is 'the boys' or it could also mean 'the boys and girls'.  Nino can also be used to mean boys or boys and girls, nina means girls.

questions.text: Which movie stars Mel Gibson as William Wallace?
questions.explanation:
Braveheart.

	After his execution, parts of William Wallace's body were sent to various places. His head, for example, was sent to London where it was placed on a spike for others to see. You can read more about this at http://www.electricscotland.com/history/wallace.htm.

Bell.

	Alexander Graham Bell married a woman who was deaf.  He originally invented the telephone as a means to help deaf people learn to speak because the sound on the telephone magnified loudly enough that some people who were partially deaf could hear a little if the sound was made very loud.

questions.text: What does the B stand for in psychologist B. F. Skinner's name?
questions.explanation:
Burrhus.

	BF Skinner is the "Father of Behaviorism." The F in BF Skinner stands for Frederic.

questions.text: A person who loves books is called a what?
questions.explanation:
bibliophile.

	"Biblio" is the prefix that means "book".

questions.text: I am a fruit. I provide you with potassium. Monkeys love to eat me. What am I?
questions.explanation:
banana.

	Chiquita bananas started in 1870 with Captain Lorenzo Dow Baker.  In 1999 the chiquita banana celebrated its 100th birthday.  You can learn more about the history of the Chiquita Banana at www.chiquita.com.

questions.text: Who shot Alexander Hamilton in a famous duel?
questions.explanation:
Burr & Aaron Burr.

	Aaron Burr was born in 1756 in New Jersey.
